commit_message:
LeftHand: Update replication to v2.1

This patch updates replication to match the v2.1 spec. This makes it
so an entire backend can be replicated, and upon failover, all
replicated volumes will be failed over together.

cinder.conf should have the replication config group:

[lefthandrep]
hpelefthand_api_url = https://10.10.10.10:8081/lhos
hpelefthand_username = user
hpelefthand_password = pass
hpelefthand_clustername = vsa-12-5-mgmt1-vip
volume_backend_name = lefthandrep
volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.hpe.hpe_lefthand_iscsi.\
                HPELeftHandISCSIDriver
replication_device = backend_id:lh-id,
                     hpelefthand_api_url:https://11.11.11.11:8081/lhos,
                     hpelefthand_username:user2,
                     hpelefthand_password:pass2,
                     hpelefthand_clustername:vsa-12-5-mgmt2-vip

Change-Id: I5dcf09fb337490e36d89654e3e3850a5a5cbdc6e
Closes-Bug: #1542079

commit_message:
Enhanced pause and resume for maintenance mode

Adds improved pause and resume unit to the charm such tha the
charm stays paused during maintenance operations.
Sync latest version of charm-helpers for maintenance mode.
Amulet test for pause/resume actions

commit_message:
Re-format the SLO manifest file on new multipart-manifest GET call

Currently, the multipart-manifest=get call returns output in json
format that is inconsistent with the format that is used for the
multipart-manifest=put.

This in turn introduces a new call: ?multipart-manifest=get&format=raw

Change-Id: I2242943a738f667cbda6363bcb6a017f341e834f
Closes-Bug: 1252482

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-14 17:48:07.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/objects/volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Fix volume migration VolumeType exception

Since Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39 modified the default
loaded attributes, the obj_attr_is_set check in finish_volume_migration
is now True for VolumeType. This should not get copied to the new
volume (since it's lazy-loaded based on the volume_type_id), so
this patch adds volume_type to the list of keys to ignore. To get
test coverage, test_finish_volume_migration is updated to use the
default expected_attributes and dict comprehension is updated so
it succeeds without glance_metadata being present.

Change-Id: Id3670dba79afb0d9d1b686ac2772c955372e97af
Closes-Bug: #1555862
Depends-On: I2caf4d3f4aa088d099548e6e88d1776b4cc5810c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volume migration VolumeType exception

Since Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39 modified the default
loaded attributes, the obj_attr_is_set check in finish_volume_migration
is now True for VolumeType. This should not get copied to the new
volume (since it's lazy-loaded based on the volume_type_id), so
this patch adds volume_type to the list of keys to ignore. To get
test coverage, test_finish_volume_migration is updated to use the
default expected_attributes and dict comprehension is updated so
it succeeds without glance_metadata being present.

Change-Id: Id3670dba79afb0d9d1b686ac2772c955372e97af
Closes-Bug: #1555862
Depends-On: I2caf4d3f4aa088d099548e6e88d1776b4cc5810c

subject: update quota of origin user on share extend/shrink
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 14:08:16.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/test_api.py', 'manila/share/api.py', 'manila/share/manager.py', 'manila/tests/share/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'update quota of origin user on share extend/shrink

When extending or shrinking a share, the quota of the current context
user gets increased. But when the share gets removed only the quota
of the user that created the share will be decreased.
This patch only updates the quota values for the user, who created the
share, on share extend/shrink actions, to properly decrease quota, once
the share gets deleted.

Change-Id: Iec4b64e96bd0bd3e354532716c9debbce815520d
Closes-Bug: #1555604
'}]
commit_message:
update quota of origin user on share extend/shrink

When extending or shrinking a share, the quota of the current context
user gets increased. But when the share gets removed only the quota
of the user that created the share will be decreased.
This patch only updates the quota values for the user, who created the
share, on share extend/shrink actions, to properly decrease quota, once
the share gets deleted.

Change-Id: Iec4b64e96bd0bd3e354532716c9debbce815520d
Closes-Bug: #1555604

commit_message:
Accept icmpv6 as protocol of SG rule for backward compatibility

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252155/ renamed
'icmpv6' protocol to 'ipv6-icmp'.
This leads to backward compatiblity of the security group API.
This commit allows to specify 'icmpv6' as well.

TODO(amotoki): The constant for 'icmpv6' will be moved to
neutron-lib soon after Mitaka is shipped.

Change-Id: I0d7e1cd9fc075902449c5eb5ef27069083ab95d4
Closes-Bug: #1558774

commit_message:
Use the catalog to retrieve glance_api_servers

Currently the config option glance_api_servers must be
set to give the correct list of glance API URLs. This
patch enables the use of the catalog to find the glance
endpoint when this config option is set to None, and
changes its default to None as well.

Closes-bug: #1371644
DocImpact: The config options glance_host and glance_port
have been removed, the default value for glance_api_servers
has been changed to None, and a new config option
glance_catalog_info has been added to glance_opts.
Change-Id: I261da528eb008f6b2520aef043c06697bd5ce352

commit_message:
make use of the wipe_root_device_metadata command

Ie68cb6296c782e904d40f6e9de0faa52ab2af2bf introduces the
'wipe_root_device_metadata' commad. This command will clean up all
the magic strings (partition table, RAID, LVM, etc) of the disk.

The purpose of this command is to be used before a new deployment
over iscsi (do_agent_iscsi_deploy) to clean the disk before it get
shared over iscsi.

Change-Id: Id2cc3a740128d7adacdc0df25d3f4eb333e3f1c5

commit_message:
Provide correct connector for evacuate terminate

During evacuation a local connector is built. This is the
wrong connector to use for cinder terminate_connection.
In order to fix this, store the initial connector with
the BDM connection_info. Use the stored connector when
we detect that we have this wrong host situation.

This fix does not work for existing attachments
(made prior to this patch) because existing attachments
don't have the connector stashed in the bdm.connection_info.
In cases where the original connector was not saved, leave
the behavior as-is.

Conflicts:
   nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Change-Id: I793f2996fc0af1c321a240ad9348dc9bce816030
Partial-Bug: #1522496
(cherry picked from commit a686185fc02ec421fd27270a343c19f668b95da6)

commit_message:
Blacklist TestOSAPIFixture.test_responds_to_version in python3

In python3 the test blocks in epoll() for 10-15 minutes. This can
lead to gate job timeouts (as a result of the cumulative time being
extended by this one test). The root cause has been tracked to eventlet
itself.

Change-Id: I47e90bb613bfba76bb504a5bd0955206120b5556
Related-Bug: #1558105

Below changes are done in this commit:

a. replaced update()
update() is replaced with oslo.db's soft_delete() used in
volume_type_access_remove() function of sqlalchemy.db.api to keep
value of "id" in "deleted" column during volume type access remove
operation.
This bug will be solved after this change.

b. updated db schema
db schema of volume_type_projects if updated.
As tinyint can store maximum 127, "deleted" column type is modified
tinyint->integer so that it can store more than 128 entries in it.

c. release notes
release notes added to prohibit addition or deletion of
volume_type_access to a project during update operation.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1518363

Change-Id: I638a202dfb2b4febf1d623683de22df3b6dc2615
(cherry picked from commit b2cd356cacad84d925a5781c7ac6c56c68a73e04)
'}]
commit_message:
Updated "deleted" column of volume_type_access

Below changes are done in this commit:

a. replaced update()
update() is replaced with oslo.db's soft_delete() used in
volume_type_access_remove() function of sqlalchemy.db.api to keep
value of "id" in "deleted" column during volume type access remove
operation.
This bug will be solved after this change.

b. updated db schema
db schema of volume_type_projects if updated.
As tinyint can store maximum 127, "deleted" column type is modified
tinyint->integer so that it can store more than 128 entries in it.

c. release notes
release notes added to prohibit addition or deletion of
volume_type_access to a project during update operation.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1518363

Change-Id: I638a202dfb2b4febf1d623683de22df3b6dc2615
(cherry picked from commit b2cd356cacad84d925a5781c7ac6c56c68a73e04)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 11:18:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Remove auto generated module api documentation

This disables the generation of the raw module api documentation in
our docs target. It is mostly not useful, as it builds a giant tree of
module documentation that are 98% boiler plate lists of methods with
no real content.

We leave the sphinx.ext.autodoc in the conf, which allows you to
specifically pull in modules for documentation when you want
to. doc/source/services.rst is an example of doing this in tree, which
still works after this change.

Change-Id: I4c10a8e45756cdcf612faca574e2fb3b7ffa2bdb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove auto generated module api documentation

This disables the generation of the raw module api documentation in
our docs target. It is mostly not useful, as it builds a giant tree of
module documentation that are 98% boiler plate lists of methods with
no real content.

We leave the sphinx.ext.autodoc in the conf, which allows you to
specifically pull in modules for documentation when you want
to. doc/source/services.rst is an example of doing this in tree, which
still works after this change.

Change-Id: I4c10a8e45756cdcf612faca574e2fb3b7ffa2bdb

subject: Delete detached vrrp ports when a newtork is removed
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-18 19:27:10.000000000', 'files': ['astara/instance_manager.py', 'astara/test/unit/test_instance_manager.py'], 'message': 'Delete detached vrrp ports when a newtork is removed

When a tenant network is detached from the logical router
the related vrrp port on the astara router is detached but
not deleted. That makes any attempt to delete the network
fail.

Change-Id: I721b25f72a4b0afb1d02fa0e50c5112d66bcd15d
Signed-off-by: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>
Closes-Bug: 1531274
'}]
commit_message:
Delete detached vrrp ports when a newtork is removed

When a tenant network is detached from the logical router
the related vrrp port on the astara router is detached but
not deleted. That makes any attempt to delete the network
fail.

Change-Id: I721b25f72a4b0afb1d02fa0e50c5112d66bcd15d
Signed-off-by: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>
Closes-Bug: 1531274

commit_message:
Avoid l3_hamode_db when creating HA router

This avoids create_router() from calling the l3_hamode_db's method,
which assumes we're running agent-based HA and does some setup
and enforces agent checks.

Partially-implements: blueprint appliance-ha

Change-Id: Icbca3966901d22978bd987faa00b0f48d5e453bb

subject: Fix keypair create --public-key
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-18 17:48:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/keypair.py'], 'message': 'Fix keypair create --public-key

Commit Id702ccaad239b916340bb17014d1ede0a28aaec9 changed the keypair
create --public-key to use io.open but incorrectly reads the file
in binary mode, which causes JSON serialization to fail.

The unit tests mock out io.ioen (the reason for adding it in the first
place actually) so any testing for this specific problem would have to
be done in functional tests...yet to come.

Closes-bug: 1559125
Change-Id: I7a299a542d9df543bff43d3ea1e7907fc8c5f640
'}]
commit_message:
Fix keypair create --public-key

Commit Id702ccaad239b916340bb17014d1ede0a28aaec9 changed the keypair
create --public-key to use io.open but incorrectly reads the file
in binary mode, which causes JSON serialization to fail.

The unit tests mock out io.ioen (the reason for adding it in the first
place actually) so any testing for this specific problem would have to
be done in functional tests...yet to come.

Closes-bug: 1559125
Change-Id: I7a299a542d9df543bff43d3ea1e7907fc8c5f640

Since commit Id65b7e106d62be92467c18bcb93c9d5da716242f we do not need to

PostgreSQL installation as well as MySQL. This commit stops running

commit_message:
Use PostgreSQL setup provided by OpenStack Infra

Since commit Id65b7e106d62be92467c18bcb93c9d5da716242f we do not need to
setup PostgreSQL for tests. Now OpenStack Infra provides ready to use
PostgreSQL installation as well as MySQL. This commit stops running
setup code and unblocks gate tests on OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: I80b1fdc4ecd5ec8a125a1cc6c9ffd96ec5d6a604

commit_message:
Adds ability to run appliance with user-specified drivers/images

This allow users to specify the driver and image associated with
a network function.  This is dependent on the correct API extension
being loaded into neutron from the astara-neutron repo.

Depends-on: I6b6f98e8ae89c704f45b05f87f17ebed5a70fc1d

Partially-implements: blueprint astara-sfc

Co-authored by: Mark McClain <mark@mcclain.xyz>

Change-Id: I1c349e56fd23d1aa95c7f8c0da68d25246b0ceb2

commit_message:
Always install software-properties-common package

The neutron-lbaas devstack plugin is failing on stable/liberty
trying to run add-apt-repository.  Change the script to always
install the package it lives in.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-02 23:09:30.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/volume-filtering-for-quoted-display-name-7f5e8ac888a73001.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v2/test_volumes.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'Fix volume filtering for quoted display name

Cinder v2 API allows creating a volume with a quoted (single or double
quotes or even unbalanced number of quotes) display name. But when we
try to get info for such volume, we end up getting an error message
saying that no volume with such a name or ID exists. This error is due
to the inadvertent stripping of quotes from the filter in the api layer.

The api call eventually comes to check_volume_filters() in
cinder/volume/api.py. The invocation of ast.literal_eval() inside this
method strips the quotes for certain quoted strings leading to this
incorrect filtering. ast.literal_eval() is used to convert string
representations into python objects which are then used to frame the
SQL queries in the db layer. For example, the string "[1,2]" for a
filter (not the display name filter) gets converted to a list object
and results in an "IN" operation being emitted in the SQL query as
opposed to an exact match.

When display_name does not contain any quotes or contains an unbalanced
number of quotes, then ast.literal_eval() throws (just like the Python
interpreter would throw for an unquoted string literal or one with
unbalanced number of quotes). We handle this by ignoring the exception
and using the raw input value as the filter and moving on. For string
containing balanced number of quotes, such as, '"foo"',
ast.literal_eval() succeeds and returns the input with the surrounding
quotes stripped (just like how the python interpreter strips quotes
from a string literal to initialize a string var's value in memory).
To always use the raw user input string as the filter value, we can
either not pass string inputs to ast.literal_eval() or encode the
string using encode("string-escape") so that we get the original string
back after passing through ast.literal_eval(). We choose the former as
the latter buys us nothing.

Change-Id: I48e0aea801ccb011cb974eea3d685bb9f35c61b2
Closes-Bug: #1503485
'}]
commit_message:
Fix volume filtering for quoted display name

Cinder v2 API allows creating a volume with a quoted (single or double
quotes or even unbalanced number of quotes) display name. But when we
try to get info for such volume, we end up getting an error message
saying that no volume with such a name or ID exists. This error is due
to the inadvertent stripping of quotes from the filter in the api layer.

The api call eventually comes to check_volume_filters() in
cinder/volume/api.py. The invocation of ast.literal_eval() inside this
method strips the quotes for certain quoted strings leading to this
incorrect filtering. ast.literal_eval() is used to convert string
representations into python objects which are then used to frame the
SQL queries in the db layer. For example, the string "[1,2]" for a
filter (not the display name filter) gets converted to a list object
and results in an "IN" operation being emitted in the SQL query as
opposed to an exact match.

When display_name does not contain any quotes or contains an unbalanced
number of quotes, then ast.literal_eval() throws (just like the Python
interpreter would throw for an unquoted string literal or one with
unbalanced number of quotes). We handle this by ignoring the exception
and using the raw input value as the filter and moving on. For string
containing balanced number of quotes, such as, '"foo"',
ast.literal_eval() succeeds and returns the input with the surrounding
quotes stripped (just like how the python interpreter strips quotes
from a string literal to initialize a string var's value in memory).
To always use the raw user input string as the filter value, we can
either not pass string inputs to ast.literal_eval() or encode the
string using encode("string-escape") so that we get the original string
back after passing through ast.literal_eval(). We choose the former as
the latter buys us nothing.

Change-Id: I48e0aea801ccb011cb974eea3d685bb9f35c61b2
Closes-Bug: #1503485

devstack: Add astara LBAAS support

This rolls out neutron-lbaas when ASTARA_ENABLED_DRIVERS contains
the 'loadbalancer' driver.  It uses the same appliance image as router
and assumes it was built with the corresponding loadbalancer enabled there.

This begins to fix the RUG's bandwidth notification code.  If configured
to use ceilometer and you somehow trigger a ReadStats state transition,
you'll find that the vm manager does not expose any way of collecting

Change-Id: I17032c6f9e4a7f3a9f575a1667498c1cc79eba4c

commit_message:
Repair the semi-functional notification publisher

This begins to fix the RUG's bandwidth notification code.  If configured
to use ceilometer and you somehow trigger a ReadStats state transition,
you'll find that the vm manager does not expose any way of collecting
stats.  This adds some basic functionality that we can refine to meet
standard ceilometer and neutron notification specs.

Change-Id: I17032c6f9e4a7f3a9f575a1667498c1cc79eba4c

commit_message:
Assign management port to a management security group

This adds creation of a management security group on the service tenant
that ensures IPv4 + IPv6 API traffic can reach the appliance. It also
enables SSH and ICMP by default, for debugging.

Additionally, it adds a new configuration setting
'management_extra_security_group_ids' that allows operators to specify
additional security groups to be assigned to the management port.

Closes-bug: #1451622

Change-Id: I5a47cd306f6f7f1b005c26971a042163a2f86e88

subject: yum_install_package: fix errexit and retry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 02:27:59.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'yum_install_package: fix errexit and retry

Since I93e9f312a94aeb086925e069a83ec1d3d3419423 yum_install isn't safe
under errexit.  This means it really only works when called by
tools/install_prereqs.sh because for some reason, we don't set that
there.

However, there is a problem with the retry logic when detecting failed
installs.  A failed package install should stop further progress, but
with the current retry logic it just goes ahead and retries the
installation, which then incorrectly passes.  You can see this
happening in a test like [1].

In our detection scripts, make a failed package or missing packages
exit with error-code 2, and "die" when we see this to correctly stop.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/81/285881/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-platform-fedora23-nv/a83be30/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

Change-Id: I4ea5515fa8e82a66aefa3ec3a48b823b645274f7
'}]
commit_message:
yum_install_package: fix errexit and retry

Since I93e9f312a94aeb086925e069a83ec1d3d3419423 yum_install isn't safe
under errexit.  This means it really only works when called by
tools/install_prereqs.sh because for some reason, we don't set that
there.

However, there is a problem with the retry logic when detecting failed
installs.  A failed package install should stop further progress, but
with the current retry logic it just goes ahead and retries the
installation, which then incorrectly passes.  You can see this
happening in a test like [1].

In our detection scripts, make a failed package or missing packages
exit with error-code 2, and "die" when we see this to correctly stop.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/81/285881/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-platform-fedora23-nv/a83be30/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

Change-Id: I4ea5515fa8e82a66aefa3ec3a48b823b645274f7

commit_message:
Functional tests for openstackclient help messages

Add tests for list and description for Server commands:
 - Check server commands in main help message.
 - Check list of server-related commands only.
Commands:
  server add security group,
  server add volume,
  server create,
  server delete,
  server dump create,
  server image create,
  server list,
  server lock,
  server migrate,
  server pause,
  server reboot,
  server rebuild,
  server remove security group,
  server remove volume,
  server rescue,
  server resize,
  server resume,
  server set,

  server ssh,
  server start,
  server stop,
  server suspend,
  server unlock,
  server unpause,

commit_message:
Add support for VPNaaS

This change adds support for VPNaaS to appliance router driver.  Since
VPNaaS is a router based service, each router driver must implement it's
own configuration rendering.

Implements-Blueprint: neutron-vpnaas

commit_message:
Adds Astara BYONF API extension

Adds the BYONF portion of the BYONF functionality.
This thin layer simply stores some data in the Neutron DB. A in-tree
migration repo has been setup to migrate the neutron DB to add the
necessary table.

Partially-implements: blueprint astara-sfc

Co-authored by: Mark McClain <mark@mcclain.xyz>

Change-Id: I6b6f98e8ae89c704f45b05f87f17ebed5a70fc1d

commit_message:
Implement base configuration for OpenStack-CI

This patch includes the following:

 - Base configuration for OpenStack's CI Infrastructure.
 - Base documentation build configuration.
 - A Vagrantfile for local testing.
 - A base test configuration in order to execute the standard tests.
 - An updated README, and added a CONTRIBUTING file.
 - The extras folder and files have been updated to match current
   conventions.

Change-Id: Ic85e398509b5069633f9b5865aff941d69ef7fbf

subject: Add option to enable/disable mongodb cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-18 19:07:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Add option to enable/disable mongodb cluster

This patch allows for enabling or disabling `cluster_support` in
devstack. This is useful for cases where nodes don't have enough
resources (or a good way) to deploy an entire DB cluster for tests (e.i
OpenStack's CI).

This is needed to run partial tests for MongoDB in the CI environment
since MongoDB's cluster requires at around 7 instances to be deployed.

Change-Id: I7600f1efe7186d414d806bba2cea7f31b26d50f6
"}]
commit_message:
Add option to enable/disable mongodb cluster

This patch allows for enabling or disabling `cluster_support` in
devstack. This is useful for cases where nodes don't have enough
resources (or a good way) to deploy an entire DB cluster for tests (e.i
OpenStack's CI).

This is needed to run partial tests for MongoDB in the CI environment
since MongoDB's cluster requires at around 7 instances to be deployed.

Change-Id: I7600f1efe7186d414d806bba2cea7f31b26d50f6

subject: Fix duplicate entries displayed w/"index sync".
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-18 18:29:52.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/cmd/manage.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix duplicate entries displayed w/"index sync".

The "index sync" command will list the set of plugins to be
re-synced for the user. When we switched over to the Resource
Group Model, the code to display the plugins was based on the
older index model and implicitly relied on the child-parent
relationship to control what got displayed. We need to make this
relationship more explicit in determining the plugins to display.

Change-Id: I88af5e7a6837ea7529b487ee1f8fabeb2b783958
Closes-Bug: #1557303
'}]
commit_message:
Fix duplicate entries displayed w/"index sync".

The "index sync" command will list the set of plugins to be
re-synced for the user. When we switched over to the Resource
Group Model, the code to display the plugins was based on the
older index model and implicitly relied on the child-parent
relationship to control what got displayed. We need to make this
relationship more explicit in determining the plugins to display.

Change-Id: I88af5e7a6837ea7529b487ee1f8fabeb2b783958
Closes-Bug: #1557303

commit_message:
Removes the attributes based choice options in instance page filter

In instances page the filter option is not user friendly. filter by id
is not useful for non admin users. This patch removes the choice options
in instances page both in admin->instances & project->instances
and makes the filter match the other pages across the stack.

Change-Id: If19ebd6cfbc8dab83b8c143c0be2ee7a5543d2b9
Closes-bug: #1482792

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-24 23:21:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/databases/workflows/create_instance.py'], 'message': 'Launch Instance Advanced tab only shown if Swift present

The launch instance options in the Advanced tab are to create an

without swift.

Change-Id: I275d513b9ab8041f02d638275a5e950c26fd10ec
'}]
commit_message:
Launch Instance Advanced tab only shown if Swift present

The launch instance options in the Advanced tab are to create an
instance from a backup or as a replica of another instance.  Both
of these capabilities are only supported if Swift is running in
the environment.  This tab should not be shown in environment
without swift.

Change-Id: I275d513b9ab8041f02d638275a5e950c26fd10ec

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-02 12:26:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/create_instance.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py'], 'message': 'Pre-create neutron ports on instance creation

Precreate the neutron ports through neutron.port_create
before the instance gets created. This gives us more
customizability like assigning the nic to a specific subnet.

The nova instance create api does not support specifying a subnet
as part of the networks parameter.

This patch does not change any behaviour or funcionality
but only changes the internal workflow of instance
creation.

Change-Id: I85be8e0df5e57e96691e7502ed398282f684db69
Partial-bug: #1324452
'}]
commit_message:
Pre-create neutron ports on instance creation

Precreate the neutron ports through neutron.port_create
before the instance gets created. This gives us more
customizability like assigning the nic to a specific subnet.

The nova instance create api does not support specifying a subnet
as part of the networks parameter.

This patch does not change any behaviour or funcionality
but only changes the internal workflow of instance
creation.

Change-Id: I85be8e0df5e57e96691e7502ed398282f684db69
Partial-bug: #1324452

commit_message:
Logout url is hard coded

This patch uses the LOGOUT_URL config value instead of the
hard-coded value. This error occurs when angular receives a
401 response and attempts to log out the user.

Closes-bug: #1444725

Change-Id: I6e29766e2a99ed809b9306e8b1c9e6d412922989

commit_message:
Remove N1K profile support

The Cisco N1K profile code is being moved out of the Horizon master
repo and into the horizon-cisco-ui repo. This is part of that
vendor decomposition.
Removing the profile support code from the networks panel of the
projects dashboard. Also removing supporting unit test code.

Change-Id: I99521554ede85ca831c4c47e87241f795636e708
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-vendor-split

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6638, 'name': 'Bradley Jones', 'email': 'jones.bradley@me.com', 'username': 'bradjones'}, {'_account_id': 8040, 'name': 'Timur Sufiev', 'email': 'tsufiev@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsufiev'}, {'_account_id': 9622, 'name': 'Cindy Lu', 'email': 'clu@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'clu14'}, {'_account_id': 9981, 'name': 'Doug Fish', 'email': 'drfish@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'doug-fish'}, {'_account_id': 13785, 'name': 'Kelly Domico', 'email': 'kelly.domico@hp.com', 'username': 'kdomico'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-14 08:59:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/network-topology/network-topology.controller.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/widgets.module.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/network_topology/templates/network_topology/index.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/dashboard.module.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/topology-graph/topology-graph.module.js', 'openstack_dashboard/enabled/_10_project.py', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/topology-graph/topology-graph.directive.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/network_topology/templates/network_topology/_svg_element.html', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/network-topology/network-topology.module.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/topology-graph/config-topology-node.directive.js'], 'message': "Refactor network topology graph as an Angular directive

Separate network topology graph into reusable part and
network-specific part. Reusable part which is implemented as
<topology-graph> directive

* takes care of initial rendering according to the data provided in
  '=data' attribute;
* re-renders its contents each time '=data' changes on scope;
* provides one-level grouping via using convex hulls and 'contains'
  array on each node that contains sub-nodes;
* exposes an API via controller which is used for customizing reusable
  graph - i.e., specific node glyphs, sizes, affinities, callbacks
  etc.

All the specific network code is placed into network topology controller, including:

* initial data transformations, i.e. marking different nodes with

* all the legacy code related to pop-ups creation and behavior (copied

  what was broken still is broken).

  'type' key on a an object for type-checking).
* refactored group collapse & expand logic: more intensive use of
  d3.js data joins, all the node hidden in a collapsed group are moved
  to a separate $hiddenNodes array, and put back to $nodes once the
  group is expanded - with d3.js handling re-rendering of this stuff
  for us in a $drawGraph method. The same applies to redrawing the
  links of hidden nodes.
* refactored type-dispatched rendering of nodes in $drawGraph to make
  them use type-specific attributes (in situation when specific types
  and stylings are not known in advance) - by using
  d3.selection.filter function.

graph. I merely claim that the current refactoring didn't break a lot
of things, i.e. the things that worked before in network topology
still work :). Among other features/fixes that are yet to be done are:

* add tests and documentation
* make the code adhere to JP styleguide
* ensure that the proposed level of directive abstraction works for at
  least 2 more consumers (e.g., Workbook graph for Mistral Workbook
  Builder, HOT Template graph for Hot Builder, possible stack topology
  for an existing Heat stack).

One more remark: this commit mostly adds new lines (despite it's a
refactoring) because I didn't touch horizon.networktopology.js
original file. Once it's clear that nothing of original functionality
was lost, I'll remove it.

Implements: blueprint curvature-network-topology
Change-Id: I688f48eddcb8f22a240a94913e8879cb1332c388

commit_message:
Refactor network topology graph as an Angular directive

Separate network topology graph into reusable part and
network-specific part. Reusable part which is implemented as
<topology-graph> directive

* takes care of initial rendering according to the data provided in
  '=data' attribute;
* re-renders its contents each time '=data' changes on scope;
* provides one-level grouping via using convex hulls and 'contains'
  array on each node that contains sub-nodes;
* exposes an API via controller which is used for customizing reusable
  graph - i.e., specific node glyphs, sizes, affinities, callbacks
  etc.

All the specific network code is placed into network topology controller, including:

* initial data transformations, i.e. marking different nodes with
  different types (server/network/ext-network/router) which works in
  conjunction with <config-topology-node> directive provided for graph
  customization;
* all the legacy code related to pop-ups creation and behavior (copied
  from networktopology.js as is: what worked there still works here,
  what was broken still is broken).

Most significant changes to the original curvature topology graph code:

* simplified data containers (no usage of function constructors,
  'type' key on a an object for type-checking).
* refactored group collapse & expand logic: more intensive use of
  d3.js data joins, all the node hidden in a collapsed group are moved
  to a separate $hiddenNodes array, and put back to $nodes once the
  group is expanded - with d3.js handling re-rendering of this stuff
  for us in a $drawGraph method. The same applies to redrawing the
  links of hidden nodes.
* refactored type-dispatched rendering of nodes in $drawGraph to make
  them use type-specific attributes (in situation when specific types
  and stylings are not known in advance) - by using
  d3.selection.filter function.

This commit is just a first step in angularizing the topology
graph. I merely claim that the current refactoring didn't break a lot
of things, i.e. the things that worked before in network topology
still work :). Among other features/fixes that are yet to be done are:

* add tests and documentation
* make the code adhere to JP styleguide
* ensure that the proposed level of directive abstraction works for at
  least 2 more consumers (e.g., Workbook graph for Mistral Workbook
  Builder, HOT Template graph for Hot Builder, possible stack topology
  for an existing Heat stack).

One more remark: this commit mostly adds new lines (despite it's a
refactoring) because I didn't touch horizon.networktopology.js
original file. Once it's clear that nothing of original functionality
was lost, I'll remove it.

Implements: blueprint curvature-network-topology
Change-Id: I688f48eddcb8f22a240a94913e8879cb1332c388

commit_message:
Consider the actual quantity of available FIPs in AllocateFIP Form

In case the number of FIP that could be actually allocated in the
selected network is less than the Quota for the given User in a given
Project, use that number instead of Quota value.

Progress bar update in case of pool change is yet to be implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1431480
Change-Id: I3810cef32bc9c707a301938b3adabff6e5d3e3c3

subject: Ensure unicode and non-unicode don't mix in interpolations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 11:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/actions.py'], 'message': "Ensure unicode and non-unicode don't mix in interpolations

To be 100% safe here we need to know that both interpolation template
and its arguments are of the same type (unicode or non-unicode). This
rule can be weakened to some degree if one of the strings doesn't have
non-latin characters (so the utf-8 representation can be decoded even
with ascii codec), but relying on it is prone to errors.  If we're to
stick to u'' for interpolation templates, we need also ensure that
every possible argument to it also is of unicode type.

Change-Id: I145d70f7d4bbd08425e85f3f571db546a72973eb
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure unicode and non-unicode don't mix in interpolations

To be 100% safe here we need to know that both interpolation template
and its arguments are of the same type (unicode or non-unicode). This
rule can be weakened to some degree if one of the strings doesn't have
non-latin characters (so the utf-8 representation can be decoded even
with ascii codec), but relying on it is prone to errors.  If we're to
stick to u'' for interpolation templates, we need also ensure that
every possible argument to it also is of unicode type.

Change-Id: I145d70f7d4bbd08425e85f3f571db546a72973eb

commit_message:
Hide panels without services

Horizon attempts to show several panels when the relevant service
isn't available: Admin/Overview, Metadata defintions;
Project/Overview, Access + Security

This patch hides those panels if the needed service isn't available
and handles secondary issues of logging in with an inaccessible
default panel and not showing empty dashboards

Change-Id: Ic31a81f7263dcc8c30dd1f3d0d675e809a2ae240
Closes-bug: #1431407

commit_message:
angularJS workflow for launching heat stacks

  - replaces django multi-step form view with angular wizard
  - allows for multiple file uploads, client side file downloads
    etc. Fixes issues with file locations & environment files
  - removes support for URL template files
  - requires a custom heatclient from here:
      o https://github.com/jsomara/python-heatclient/tree/envfiles
    if this becomes a blocking issue, we can add that method to horizon
    temporarily. The other possibility is that it is extended to support
    nested stacks as well (a Juno goal). This patch includes this code
    inside horizon, with the intention of removing it when support becomes
    available in upstream python-heatclient
  - there are outstanding messaging improvements (error messages, etc) that
    this patch could take advantage of for better message dialogs

To test this, check out sample environment & template files here. You'll
notice that the referenced file in the environment will get added in
stage2 of the wizard. If you don't have any file references to resolve,
it will go straight to stage3.
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example2_server_with_volume_nested/server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/env_server_with_volume.yaml
- https://github.com/hardys/demo_templates/blob/master/juno_summit_intro_to_heat/example4_provider_environment/server_with_volume_env.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1322258
Partial-Implements:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/heat-nested-stack

Change-Id: I0916bfb22c80755efd3632c1315fe78afc86d38c

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] upstream deltas needed for neutron api

moved create Port to Ports
error message, docstring on python REST
js formatting/docstrings
fix for delete

This patch implements:
  -is_port_profiles_supported():
  -port_create
  -port_delete
  -profile_list(request, type_p)

Change-Id: Ib9ff33e662e23b4cd43ed23d7b7aa51d9ff8282b
Closes-Bug: 1434208

commit_message:
Download Reports of Horizon Detailed Views, in dfferent formats

The Admin users will be able to generate a report manually at
any time. This is useful for capturing the updated information
of instances, volumes, flavors, etc at the moment. The
generated report can then later be used for sharing/mailing
information. It will not only help the Project/Admin users in
planning, auditing and decision making, but also give a clear
view to the users about the existing data in the system.
Currently, the report generation is available in CSV and PDF
through this blueprint.

Post the implementation, we might gather the users' feedback
and expectations to extend this Report functionality and have
enhancements like creating customized reports, scheduling,
mailing and sharing them. Hence, this can be taken up as a
completely new module added to Horizon.

Dependencies are added to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/163304

Change-Id: I4b06d8637a2b5cf2ccc905d4635b280d42366571
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-reports-in-different-formats

commit_message:
Sys Info Panel - Directives instead of ng-include

An example of how using a directive, the redundant per-service table
and footer files can be removed. I didn't see an obvious
way to avoid using header and row fragments given the
way the smart table is implemented.

A nice improvement on this would be to change the directive to
transclude header and row content somehow, so that the header
and row for each service can live in the same file, allowing us
to simplify the solution to 1 overview page using 1 directive
with 1 data file per-service.

Change-Id: Id13144eb4dcb2db53fd335aa765fc09384fca784

Member can be delete, add, view by member or admin.

commit_message:
Searchlight API for horizon

Adds a REST API to make requests to searchlight. Implements
POST searchlight/search and GET searchlight/enabled-resources.

This is essentially a pass-through API to enable searchlight
integration via AJAX requests.

Change-Id: I2309c7c3ef6d8cab8d6bafdf44f5b12c433a5f5c
Implements: blueprint searchlight-images-integration

commit_message:
Add Ironic hypervisor settings to hide some unsupported actions

As Ironic baremetal nodes do not support all variety of operations
that nova virtual instances do, so add a option to settings to make
Horizon disallow inappropriate actions to be performed.

Change-Id: I4895a818fd4bd3789636d0bed7df4a8564a8a757
Closes-Bug: #1483639

commit_message:
Fixes associating the health monitor for a neutron load balance pool

This patch fixes the association problem of the health moniter for load
balancer.

commit_message:
Ajax update for table row that has any unknown status

When an instance is deleting and in error status, no ajax update is
triggered for it because the row has .status_down instead of
.status_unknown. This change triggers ajax update for row that
contains any td.status_unknown.

Change-Id: If53d43fe1365144fd1b404755d179dc709154da3
Closes-Bug: 1445276

subject: Docs for moving future client-side settings out of settings.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 21:34:12.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/conf/conf.js.example', 'doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'horizon/static/framework/conf/conf.js'], 'message': "Docs for moving future client-side settings out of settings.py

Client-side settings should not be stored in HORIZON_CONFIG
in settings.py. For example, things like page size, alert fade delays,
modal backdrop type, etc. This mixes up frontend and backend settings.

Instead, we should have one settings file for client-side
(anything used by the Horizon Angular framework)
and one for server-side.

We don't want to break backward compatibility by removing
the legacy options from settings.py, but for the future,
they should be stored in 'horizon/static/framework'.

The client-side settings are in:
horizon/static/framework/conf/conf.js

Change-Id: Icfaeee2f586e569020b657b3be97e6170b236c0d
Partially-Implements: blueprint client-side-configuration-file
"}]
commit_message:
Docs for moving future client-side settings out of settings.py

Client-side settings should not be stored in HORIZON_CONFIG
in settings.py. For example, things like page size, alert fade delays,
modal backdrop type, etc. This mixes up frontend and backend settings.

Instead, we should have one settings file for client-side
(anything used by the Horizon Angular framework)
and one for server-side.

We don't want to break backward compatibility by removing
the legacy options from settings.py, but for the future,
they should be stored in 'horizon/static/framework'.

The client-side settings are in:
horizon/static/framework/conf/conf.js

Change-Id: Icfaeee2f586e569020b657b3be97e6170b236c0d
Partially-Implements: blueprint client-side-configuration-file

subject: Truncate instance creation pop-up message
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-21 18:35:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/create_instance.py'], 'message': 'Truncate instance creation pop-up message

When an instance is successfully (or unsuccessfully) created, a
message pop up appears that displays the corresponding alert
message and includes the instance name in it.  When the instance
name is extremely long, the pop up becomes too big.  There is no
need to display the entire instance name in this message when the
name is so big. It looks obnoxious and is unnecessary.  These
messages should be truncated to a specified length.

I based this change off of a similar change that propeses to
truncate resource names in all tables based on a setting that
is, as of right now, a global setting in local_settings.py.
I use this global setting to truncate the instance name in
the pop-up message box.

Closes-Bug: #1503408
Change-Id: Ib25468703094c305228fb49dae4940529162dfa1
'}]
commit_message:
Truncate instance creation pop-up message

When an instance is successfully (or unsuccessfully) created, a
message pop up appears that displays the corresponding alert
message and includes the instance name in it.  When the instance
name is extremely long, the pop up becomes too big.  There is no
need to display the entire instance name in this message when the
name is so big. It looks obnoxious and is unnecessary.  These
messages should be truncated to a specified length.

I based this change off of a similar change that propeses to
truncate resource names in all tables based on a setting that
is, as of right now, a global setting in local_settings.py.
I use this global setting to truncate the instance name in
the pop-up message box.

Closes-Bug: #1503408
Change-Id: Ib25468703094c305228fb49dae4940529162dfa1

commit_message:
Provide option to create images by importing data

Move the "Copy data" checkbox option of the Create Image form into a
dropdown, and move the Images table into a tab. If Glance v2 is
available, add a new "Import data" option to the dropdown, which uses an
import task to create the image, and another tab in the Images panels
with a table listing all import tasks that have been created. Task names
in the table are rendered as links to details pages for the tasks.

Depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217020 to keep filtering
working in the Images table after moving it from a DataTableView to a
TabbedTableView.

Change-Id: I3ce764f0f2fa42ba3f44617050cf10042dfdd8ee
Implements: blueprint import-images

commit_message:
Update Settings tab in the dashboard

By default the Settings tab is under user icon
drop down menu. Once the Settings option is selected
from this drop down menu then only it will be
visible under dashboard tabs.

To resolve the ambiguity the Settings option is
removed from user drop down menu and added to
the dashboard tabs permanently.

Closes-Bug: #1331370

Change-Id: I0acafd9787dd759bfacbbe344392215278ef72e4

commit_message:
Add cancel button to create subnet workflow

There miss"Cancel" button in the create and update Subnet
workflow dialog in admin and project networks panel. But in
the create networks, there has cancel button. This patch
refactor the _workflow.html code, now all wizard workflow can
reuse it, and add cancel button to create and update subnet
workflow, also the ajax_template_name is no longer needs
and eliminating redundant code.

Change-Id: Ide889a8bf92ce27cff03baced7e356713ce16880
Closes-bug: #1480233

subject: Add test for policy checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-09 14:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/base.py'], 'message': 'Add test for policy checks

Created a policy test case for Panels which tests AND, OR and a mix
of AND OR logics. The test cases are :
P  = Policy rule for Panel
P1 = True
P2 = False
P3 = True
P4 = False

(P1, P2,) expands to P1 OR P2 results as True.

([P1, P2],) expands to P1 AND P2 results as False.

(P1, [P3, P4],)expands to P1 OR (P3 AND P4) results True.

Change-Id: Icf1a040c687bd8486eb2742f249d0a4e40a4f22a
'}]
commit_message:
Add test for policy checks

Created a policy test case for Panels which tests AND, OR and a mix
of AND OR logics. The test cases are :
P  = Policy rule for Panel
P1 = True
P2 = False
P3 = True
P4 = False

(P1, P2,) expands to P1 OR P2 results as True.

([P1, P2],) expands to P1 AND P2 results as False.

(P1, [P3, P4],)expands to P1 OR (P3 AND P4) results True.

Change-Id: Icf1a040c687bd8486eb2742f249d0a4e40a4f22a

commit_message:
Provide flavor overview detail page

Currently nova flavors don't expose any url where you can check details
for them. This fix provides a detail page for flavors, where base
properties, as well as custom properties could be checked.

Co-Authored-By: Dhanvi <dhanviduri@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ia5b4a49a40213ca80d8d45ca4c7c3d092c8b7036
Closes-Bug: #1405063

commit_message:
Rename helpers.py to basetestcases.py

Original filename is confusing and don't reflect usage and most of content
so well.
The helpers.py now contains just gen_random_resource_name() method. All
test-related clases are currently moved into basetestcases.py

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Implements blueprint: rename-helpers-to-basetests
Change-Id: Ie6b5d2085125245423efb68cd1ab2a42b182204c

commit_message:
Remove app-specific config from framework module

Make framework.module.js easier to resuse by moving application
specific configuration logic to app.module.js.

framework.module.js is the root module for application agnostic,
reusable horizon componenents. It currently contains
"frameworkConfiguration" which is config logic that is specific
to a particular application (openstack_dashboard), such as the
default interpolator, at the HTTP 401 response interceptor.

This patch moves everything except the interpolator config into
app.module.js

Co-Authored-By: Shaoquan Chen <sean.chen2@hp.com>

Change-Id: I41aeb0a230864f19b961c3a3024166408bdea0a6
Closes-Bug: #1474998

Integration tests - Instances tests-VNC

Added testcase to verify the  vnc console when the instance
is running, vnc console status can be checked easily as its
an iframe element and selenium allows driver to switch between
frame elements.

commit_message:
Logout user when deleting currently logged-in project

Deleting currently logged-in project, renders the environment
inoperable. This patch, logs-out the user after he
successfully deletes currently logged-in project.

Implements: blueprint project-disabling-warning
Change-Id: I70f2793dc76a4b41e47b54fa1bfa340852ce2881

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-16 22:27:28.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.realtime.js', 'openstack_dashboard/templates/horizon/_scripts.html', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js'], 'message': "Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses Zaqar's websocket service to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

With this way, we need a dedicated queue in zaqar for each project to
get the notifications from Ceilometer's Zaqar publisher, which will be
tracked/implemented by separated work/patch.

To try it out, navigate to http://localhost:8080, log in and go to the
Project -> Instances page. Then launch an instance using the Nova
command line client and try to suspend, resume and delete it from there.
The UI should update automatically.

Implements blueprint realtime-communication

Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Change-Id: I5bb39970dfd4a961b908fb2f34016957e8898c9c

commit_message:
Proof of concept for push-based communication

This uses Zaqar's websocket service to update instance state listed in
/projects/instances/.

With this way, we need a dedicated queue in zaqar for each project to
get the notifications from Ceilometer's Zaqar publisher, which will be
tracked/implemented by separated work/patch.

To try it out, navigate to http://localhost:8080, log in and go to the
Project -> Instances page. Then launch an instance using the Nova
command line client and try to suspend, resume and delete it from there.
The UI should update automatically.

Implements blueprint realtime-communication

Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Fei Long Wang <flwang@catalyst.net.nz>

Change-Id: I5bb39970dfd4a961b908fb2f34016957e8898c9c

commit_message:
Add a status to the process provided with the logout.

message of the process provided with the logout is error color,
since the message that is displayed after logout doesn't have
status attribute. This patch adds a status to the process
provided with the logout.

Change-Id: Id4617adae70569dabe054a17048be79b417b1b8c
Closes-bug: #1520486

commit_message:
Add version check for listing namespaces

Listing metadata definitions namespaces requires glance API version
2. This adds a check that makes sure an empty array is returned if
any version less than 2 is being used.

Closes-Bug: #1516711
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-glance-v2
Change-Id: Ifc0a091318296da06168f9701a280eb7357632c7
(cherry picked from commit 0578023d881ab77fb6708ca39a99f772763ef1a6)

Adds router create/delete integration tests

This change prevents field validation on the input sources that

Closes-Bug: 1360244

commit_message:
Better validation of stack template and environment

The stack template and environment can be provided from several
sources such as inline, URL or file. The form includes dropdowns
that all the user to select which of the allowed sources to use.
This change prevents field validation on the input sources that
are not selected, only the content entered for the selected source
is validated. If any data is entered into form fields that are not
currently selected then that data is ignored, since it would be
unexpected to receive a validation failure for a form field that
is hidden.

Change-Id: I33f1d9f3aaef3998a4044d5ad6bd449f7218b83f
Closes-Bug: 1360244

subject: WIP: Convert the Heat stack creation wizard to a workflow
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-07 21:30:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/templates/stacks/create.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/templates/stacks/_select_template.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/workflows.py', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.modals.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/urls.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/templates/stacks/select_template.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/forms.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/templates/stacks/_create.html'], 'message': "WIP: Convert the Heat stack creation wizard to a workflow

The current Heat stack creation wizard is implemented using two seperate
forms.  This results in the inability to move back and forth between steps
in the creation process without first cancelling the entire wizard and
starting over.  This change aims to improve the user experience on this
page by converting this wizard to a Horizon 'workflow'.  Being that it is a
workflow, users will have the ability to freely move back and forth between
steps to modify previous fields without cancelling the entire process and
starting over, much like the current implementations of many of the other
resource creation wizards (Instances, Images, Networks, etc.).

Some client side JS had to written in order to dynamically create fields
in step 2 of the workflow based on template parameters entered in step 1.
It is a bit of a workaround to the traditional implementation of a workflow,
which is why I imagine that it was not done as a workflow in the first place.
That being said, the workflow functions exactly as all other Horizon workflows
and still provides the same functionality as the existing Heat stack creation
wizard.

Co-Authored-By: Justin Pomeroy <jpomero@us.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint launch-stack-workflow
Change-Id: I3232a31673fe4ae7951dda921aab4609447f3a3d
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Convert the Heat stack creation wizard to a workflow

The current Heat stack creation wizard is implemented using two seperate
forms.  This results in the inability to move back and forth between steps
in the creation process without first cancelling the entire wizard and
starting over.  This change aims to improve the user experience on this
page by converting this wizard to a Horizon 'workflow'.  Being that it is a
workflow, users will have the ability to freely move back and forth between
steps to modify previous fields without cancelling the entire process and
starting over, much like the current implementations of many of the other
resource creation wizards (Instances, Images, Networks, etc.).

Some client side JS had to written in order to dynamically create fields
in step 2 of the workflow based on template parameters entered in step 1.
It is a bit of a workaround to the traditional implementation of a workflow,
which is why I imagine that it was not done as a workflow in the first place.
That being said, the workflow functions exactly as all other Horizon workflows
and still provides the same functionality as the existing Heat stack creation
wizard.

Co-Authored-By: Justin Pomeroy <jpomero@us.ibm.com>
Implements: blueprint launch-stack-workflow
Change-Id: I3232a31673fe4ae7951dda921aab4609447f3a3d

commit_message:
This patch creates a page which has four tables to show data of vpn.

It has data of Ikepolicy,data of,data of Vpnservice, and data of Ipsecsiteconnection.
The four parts are tables of vpn,here I put them in one page with one controller.
It follows the pattern with nguser.

Change-Id: Ifc57754cc22a18ff66c0c93b39e6409c905e20f4
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-vpn-table

commit_message:
This patch creates a page which has four tables to show data of vpn.
It has data of Ikepolicy,data of,data of Vpnservice, and data of Ipsecsiteconnection.
The four parts are tables of vpn,here I put them in one page with one controller.
It follows the pattern with nguser.
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-vpn-table

Change-Id: I62533c65291426828383ed6bcfb0b6c640aed747
Signed-off-by: hanjiabao <hanjiabao@awcloud.com>

commit_message:
Use workflow field errors on admin create flavor workflow

When input a flavor name or flavor ID that already exist, we will
see the error message on the top of the workflow modal. If the error
message beside the input box, it will be more better.

Change-Id: I2e8889a9bfac24811be8f0a7d624e4431cd46a38
Closes-Bug: #1487731

commit_message:
Single page navigation

Based on Thai Tran's work this patchset implements a way of simulating
a single page app whilst allowing the use of panels not yet rewritten
in angular.

It works by intercepting the navigation links and using an ajax call to
get the new page content rather than doing a full page refresh. This
improves performance by allowing for caching of angular and application
data. It is not a true single page app, but gets us a step closer.

Known issues:

  - More tests need to be implemented.

Change-Id: I568b747c71f85541c50eafd9e4845e0772d6455d
Implements: blueprint single-page-navigation

commit_message:
Mock API - mock 401 error

This patch mocks 401 error in `horizon.mock.app.core.Server`. When
access a vaid URL in API, if has logged in, access is allowed,
otherwise, return 401 (Unauthorized) status code.

Change-Id: Ieb10a693755d19c6d30f5eae01fbfd85b25d6002
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-rest-api-mock

commit_message:
Added pagination support for swift containers.

The _more variable in the ContainerView has been split
in _more_containers and _more_objects to prevent overlaping
and perhaps allow future object pagination.
There have been changes in the _resource_browser template to
allow displaying the next page link; however, the embedding
form has not been changed (action remains without marker) and
the test only states the existence of the next link in the
first page

Closes-Bug: #1255411
Change-Id: I35ecaad41af93ed023b44011e9eb948cdb784911

commit_message:
fix table action translation

Table action success message and info message are not
properly translated.
1, It is not necessary to translate the objects(objs)
2, Break down the msg into more granular level, so the
    django.po can be easily make.

Change-Id: I77da7f0659409a87808512e9deb9029b457ec293
Closes-Bug: #1534939

commit_message:
Topology View for Identity

Providing a topological view of identity entities(domains,
projects, groups, users and roles) aims openstack users
to have a bird-eye-view of how identity is structured
in their cloud. This patch, draws identity topology
canvas including all of the identity entries and their
hierarchical relations.

Change-Id: I5d72bf2d9b3b4d8c5899d06d29a899579ee9353b
Implements: blueprint identity-topology

to login page automatically - as this is probably requirement for all
tests(in case of login test one needs to be on login page as well).
I have added decorators that enables to specify user role within
which test should be executed when ran within MultiUserTestCase.

All test methods will now have suffix that says within which role was
test executed.(Accept for login_url test and tests that inherits from
BaseTestCase class generally)

I have added following classes:

* MetaStandardUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_standard_user' suffix to
                             test methods name.

* MetaAdminUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_admin_user' suffix to test
                          methods name.

* MetaMultiUserTestCase - spawns two instances of each test with
                          appropriate suffix unless decorator is used.

* LoggedInTestCase - class for test cases that needs log out in
                     tearDown.

* AdminUserTesCase - ensures that test is executed within admin user
                     role.

* StandardUserTestCase - ensures that test is executed within standard
                         user role.

* MultiUserTestCase - ensures that test is executed within correct user,
                      this depends on test method suffix.

Decoratos:

* admin_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
                             admin user context

* standard_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
                                standard user context.

Closes-Bug: #1353334
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I79ac16093a62591ece344794fb08139a1a0a8ab3
"}]
commit_message:
Add multi role test possibility to integr. tests

Adding possibility to run tests within perspective of multiple user roles.

I have changed the behaviour of BaseTestCase, nows it redirects user
to login page automatically - as this is probably requirement for all
tests(in case of login test one needs to be on login page as well).
I have added decorators that enables to specify user role within
which test should be executed when ran within MultiUserTestCase.

All test methods will now have suffix that says within which role was
test executed.(Accept for login_url test and tests that inherits from
BaseTestCase class generally)

I have added following classes:

* MetaStandardUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_standard_user' suffix to
                             test methods name.

* MetaAdminUserTestCase - automatically adds 'as_admin_user' suffix to test
                          methods name.

* MetaMultiUserTestCase - spawns two instances of each test with
                          appropriate suffix unless decorator is used.

* LoggedInTestCase - class for test cases that needs log out in
                     tearDown.

* AdminUserTesCase - ensures that test is executed within admin user
                     role.

* StandardUserTestCase - ensures that test is executed within standard
                         user role.

* MultiUserTestCase - ensures that test is executed within correct user,
                      this depends on test method suffix.

Decoratos:

* admin_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
                             admin user context

* standard_user_only_testcase - makes test method executable only within
                                standard user context.

Closes-Bug: #1353334
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: I79ac16093a62591ece344794fb08139a1a0a8ab3

commit_message:
Fix broken error message during subnet creation

Steps to reproduce
1. In horizon, create a subnet for a network address that already exists.
2. You should see the subnet creation throw an error.
3. Notice the error message doesn't provide the network name correctly

The root cause is that one of the subnet workflows doesn't pass network object
as the create subnet function parameter.

Change-Id: I32257f14b231b01edcbac2559cf27b0bed0aa8bf
Closes-Bug: 1505414

commit_message:
Don't show assigned ports in FIP target list

In the floating IP port list, ports already assigned floating IPs
shouldn't be available targets for new ones since neutron doesn't
allow multiple FIPs for a single fixed IP.

In this patch the filtering also occurs for nova networking
although I'm not 100% nova networking has the same restriction.

Change-Id: Icf55cb09b007e7764599b727eaa7e1e2ccecc323
Closes-Bug: 1413755

commit_message:
Glance Image Member Management

Currently, Horizon does not allow to share images between
different projects. We have "Share With Me" container in
project image tab, but ability to share image is not
possible in horizon. This patch implements this feature.

Change-Id: I8ed245a8c6b28c20076624bdfe51b507a4215358
Implements: blueprint glance-image-member-management

Federated identity management closely works with Keystone service to
authenticate and authorise users. Federation uses attributes provided by
identity providers and translates it to attributes recognised by

mapping that maps attributes obtained from identity providers and maps
them to attributes that can be used in OpenStack cloud. Attribute mapping
engine uses mapping rules to map these attributes. Mapping rules are
stored in database along with mapping ID to identify these rules.

This interface allows the user to list, create, update and delete
particular mapping rules in order to reduce workload for the
administrators and reduce security risks that are associated with
issuing provisional identities. The interface should be easily used
and understood even by novice administrators.

@coauthored-by David Chadwick

'}]
commit_message:
Federated Identity Mapping

Federated identity management closely works with Keystone service to
authenticate and authorise users. Federation uses attributes provided by
identity providers and translates it to attributes recognised by
OpenStack.  Federation has integrated functionality called attribute
mapping that maps attributes obtained from identity providers and maps
them to attributes that can be used in OpenStack cloud. Attribute mapping
engine uses mapping rules to map these attributes. Mapping rules are
stored in database along with mapping ID to identify these rules.

This interface allows the user to list, create, update and delete
particular mapping rules in order to reduce workload for the
administrators and reduce security risks that are associated with
issuing provisional identities. The interface should be easily used
and understood even by novice administrators.

@author Anton Brinda
@coauthored-by David Chadwick

Change-Id: Id6b693ac642c1caf4765dedf2808d4ea340deba4

commit_message:
Mock API - Basic mock API server constructor

This patch defines a constructor function `horizon.mock.app.core.Server`
on a mock module `horizon.mock.app.core`.  The constructor can be used
to create mock server instances.

Specs for the constructor is also created to spec the constructor and
show how to use it to construct mock server in specs.

Change-Id: Ia10ea724a3ebf1563a594d1b8958c7d052b5c4cf
Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-rest-api-mock

The variable $static_url used in scss code is by default derived from the

overrides that, causing the awesome fonts to be not found when running in the
Django developmental server, where the $static_url is expected to be

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded $static_url in _variables.scss

The variable $static_url used in scss code is by default derived from the
option STATIC_URL in settings.py [1]. But the hard-coded definition
overrides that, causing the awesome fonts to be not found when running in the
Django developmental server, where the $static_url is expected to be
'/static/'. This commit removes the hard-coding and restores the
default.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/horizon/utils/scss_filter.py#L35

Change-Id: I0fe115d299e7b98816ce9b3b2b41373364b439b3
Closes-Bug: 1539871

commit_message:
Remove dup custom style imports

Previously @import "/custom/styles"; has a comment of "// Custom Style
Variables " which make it looks like a scss file with only variables, in
that case it should be import to each scss file that will be injected to
_stylesheet.html directly. Confirm with devs, "/custom/styles" should
only include custom styles, than it should be imported only once.

Also, we need to make sure, /custom/styles should come at the very
bottom of the combined css file.

Change-Id: Ic9f168b746ed51c2c0ee864759c36a77d9645241
Closes-Bug: #1480427

commit_message:
Activate the timezone while we can get from request.COOKIES

How to reproduce the problem.
The instance is created at Jan. 17, 2015, 3:02 p.m.(UTC +08:00),
The creation time in UTC is Jan. 17, 2015, 7:02 a.m.

1. Save Timezone as UTC in user settings page,
   the creation time is Jan. 17, 2015, 7:02 a.m.
2. Save Timezone as UTC +08:00 in user settings page,
   the creation time is Jan. 17, 2015, 3:02 p.m.
3. logout horizon
4. login horizon
5. the timezone of user settings page is UTC +08:00,
   but the creation time of instance in detail page
   is UTC time(Jan. 17, 2015, 7:02 a.m.)

lastly, the patch fix it.

Change-Id: Id1fd61e8d7c5bb1424017cb7263dc85e0dc0af8f
Closes-Bug: 1418031

commit_message:
Implements: Addition of metadata for snapshot in VolumeSnapshot object

When accessing the snapshot object in Horizon codebase, we do not have access to the metadata of the snapshot.
This is because the VolumeSnapshot object does not have metadata as a member. So added 'metadata' to the VolumeSnapshot object.
The fix should provide access to metadata.
Added test data and test cases for snapshot object with metadata.

Change-Id: I2e893572d2ef76ce01fa882640dbd9eeaebbb06c
Closes-Bug: 1542468

'message': 'Remove noqa used to avoid non-module level import

In hacking 0.10.x, a hacking rule to enforce module-level import
was removed. We no longer need to use noqa to avoid it.
Removing noqa allows flake8 to detect more violations related
to import, so I believe dropping noqa will help us.

This commit also makes the following changes:

- Add reason if noqa is required.
- Use __all__ directive to avoid unused warnings in __init__ module.
- Fix various pep8 errors in api/rest/{cinder,glance}.py

Change-Id: I3101f10e04b7dfb91cc5386b243ecb6a38550358
'}]
commit_message:
Remove noqa used to avoid non-module level import

In hacking 0.10.x, a hacking rule to enforce module-level import
was removed. We no longer need to use noqa to avoid it.
Removing noqa allows flake8 to detect more violations related
to import, so I believe dropping noqa will help us.

This commit also makes the following changes:

- Add reason if noqa is required.
- Use __all__ directive to avoid unused warnings in __init__ module.
- Fix various pep8 errors in api/rest/{cinder,glance}.py

Change-Id: I3101f10e04b7dfb91cc5386b243ecb6a38550358

commit_message:
[Django 1.9] assertRedirects no forced absolute URLs

As per:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.9/releases/1.9/#http-redirects-no-longer-forced-to-absolute-uris
Django 1.9 no longer forces absolute URIs. This patch
fixes it in horizon/test/tests/*

Change-Id: Ib313eceb42cf9ee7399421a92d18173aa9903d21

commit_message:
assign cisco network profile to multiple tenants

Add the ability to assign cisco network profile to multiple tenants
during network profile creation and network profile update. The project
field in Create Network Profile and Update Network Profile will be
changed from char field a to multiple select drop down, and the name
will be changed to projects

Change-Id: Id4086859b89a942ec8abcd165ecee86175f0f684
Implements: blueprint cisco-network-profile-multi-tenant-support

commit_message:
Hierarchical Projects as Expandable Treetable

This patch allows projects in the Project Table
to be listed in a Expandable Treetable.

The used Expandable Treetable is a jQuery plugin
from http://ludo.cubicphuse.nl/jquery-treetable/,
which is under MIT license.

This patch requires the Kilo version of both
Keystone and Keystone Client, whose support the
Hierarchical Projects concept as a stable API.

Co-Authored-By: Erickson Filipe Guedes dos Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samuel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Partially Implements: blueprint hierarchical-project

Change-Id: I9a8928377b1d1b687909a141f1aa850614e3bab2

commit_message:
Launch instance not respecting picked project

while launching instance, if the user can have access
to more than one project, he can chose a project to
launch a instance.

currently the instance is always launching in the active
project instead of launching in the selected project.

Change-Id: Ic15e15c0491880b4c9264385e62da4a1c83ed68c
Closes-Bug: #1481469

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-03 11:55:53.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/site_urls.py'], 'message': 'Do not load jasmine module unconditionally

For production deployments, horizon.test.* might not
be packaged and hence unconditionally including it
causes the django app fail to start. Moving
it to an include inside the DEBUG section avoids
this.

Change-Id: I01e6d406dd16940b5fccef749fb509602b1f2e46

commit_message:
Do not load jasmine module unconditionally

For production deployments, horizon.test.* might not
be packaged and hence unconditionally including it
causes the django app fail to start. Moving
it to an include inside the DEBUG section avoids
this.

commit_message:
Adds deactivated status for glance image

This patch adds the status deactivated for
images that have been deactivated in glance
thus also fixes the issue with progress bar
after image is deactivated.

Change-Id: I24c9fecb3cf67e1a2a56a0443e272a34a3585a74
Closes-bug: #1482094
(cherry picked from commit 02ee3e41d4d7955cfb12b6e2deec3008c59e4bfb)

This fix basically ports nova fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136931/
plus additional bug fixing to Manila. It creates a common class to get
used for all clients (neutron, nova, cinder).

Idea is to create an auth session and pass this to the client object
instead of let the client do that. The auth session will be created by
a config group which means the configuration for the clients needed to be
heavily reworked. Patch is also backward compatible with old options but
flag them as deprecated.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Closes-bug: #1555093
'}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone v3 issues for all clients

This fix basically ports nova fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/136931/
plus additional bug fixing to Manila. It creates a common class to get
used for all clients (neutron, nova, cinder).

Idea is to create an auth session and pass this to the client object
instead of let the client do that. The auth session will be created by
a config group which means the configuration for the clients needed to be
heavily reworked. Patch is also backward compatible with old options but
flag them as deprecated.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d
Closes-bug: #1555093

Fix devstack/fedora/bind9 support

Also the bind9 was hardoded instead of using the $BIND_SERVICE_NAME.

commit_message:
Change inspector config to use MySQL

As a result of the playbooks combined with the use of the
sqllite database file, the inspector functionality was partially
broken and could not be re-run without clean-up, in the form of
the sqllite database file being removed, between test runs.

Closes-Bug: #1554174
Change-Id: I77d33546dd97348298072b5047502b6705dfca11

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-02-13 20:28:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_db_api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Use of metadata id instead of metadata name

If multiple image-metadata entries are present with same name
but different cases, 'image-metadata unset' command deletes all
of them irrespective of case.

For ex, "image-metadata unset abc=123" will delete all image-metadata
entries with name abc, ABC, Abc etc.

This is fixed by using id instead of name to fetch image-metadata
during 'image-metadata unset' command execution flow.

Closes-Bug: #1538418

Change-Id: I9fb29667964a4180af822b811345fa1148dbcd66
'}]
commit_message:
Use of metadata id instead of metadata name

If multiple image-metadata entries are present with same name
but different cases, 'image-metadata unset' command deletes all
of them irrespective of case.

For ex, "image-metadata unset abc=123" will delete all image-metadata
entries with name abc, ABC, Abc etc.

This is fixed by using id instead of name to fetch image-metadata
during 'image-metadata unset' command execution flow.

Closes-Bug: #1538418

Change-Id: I9fb29667964a4180af822b811345fa1148dbcd66

commit_message:
is_public=N/A in output of cinder type-update

In output of cinder type-update execution, is_public field
always displays N/A.
This is due to wrong usage of @property for is_public field
in code.

Change-Id: I1d76c3d5c937f5c16c668bd114e2df7dfc62f2f8
Closes-Bug: #1538412

During volume/snapshot create/delete operations,
dd command is used to clear contents of disk.

supports dd or not by executing dd command with

commit_message:
Handling Invalid argument iflag=direct in dd

During volume/snapshot create/delete operations,
dd command is used to clear contents of disk.

Before invoking dd, it is checked if iflag=direct
supports dd or not by executing dd command with
iflag=direct and if=/dev/zero combination.
But this always results in invalid argument
error.

Handling for this argument is done to eliminate
unnecessary call to dd command when it is used
with iflag=direct and if=/dev/zero combination
to check if this argument supports dd or not.

Closes-Bug: #1270362

Change-Id: Ic6dd029ca1a339076e491c38ef3c69315497f189
