This change documents the process of upgrading from Kilo to Liberty by
hand. The process is mostly running the playbooks that the
run-upgrade.sh script does, but allows for more control for deployers

Change-Id: I3eb1ae5e3526f7947a1731e8ce35530b5d366e27

commit_message:
Add manual upgrade step document

This change documents the process of upgrading from Kilo to Liberty by
hand. The process is mostly running the playbooks that the
run-upgrade.sh script does, but allows for more control for deployers
that want it.

Also fixed some link references that cause documentation build errors.

Change-Id: I3eb1ae5e3526f7947a1731e8ce35530b5d366e27

commit_message:
Remove assert with task.progress comparison

Task progress calculation is not strictly tied to completion of task
in fake tasks. So, it does not make sense in tests to compare task.progress
against 100% when task is completed.

Change-Id: I0cb5217f4fe4df4981d5a9b69fe353ba2641d5a9
Closes-Bug: #1558634

subject: Optimize event deserialization
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 07:28:01.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'senlin/engine/event.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_events.py'], 'message': 'Optimize event deserialization

When listing events or showing a particular event, we were
deserializing db records into python objects. We were doing so only to
make sure we can do a to_dict() conversion when dumping the event
properties. This is a huge waste. The oslo_db ModelBase class already
provided an _as_dict() method. We can leverage that to avoid such a
performance cost.

This patch proposes to 1) remove to_dict() method from Event class
which is a waste of time; 2) remove from_dict() method from Event which
is never used anywhere; 3) add an as_dict() method to the Event DB model
so that we still have a chance to convert datatime fields; 4) simplify
engine service layer so we can avoid doing deserialization of Events. 5)
remove all the deserialization methods from Event class.

Change-Id: I3b75632192014a60bb65b9556f9044a179d8d5c0
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize event deserialization

When listing events or showing a particular event, we were
deserializing db records into python objects. We were doing so only to
make sure we can do a to_dict() conversion when dumping the event
properties. This is a huge waste. The oslo_db ModelBase class already
provided an _as_dict() method. We can leverage that to avoid such a
performance cost.

This patch proposes to 1) remove to_dict() method from Event class
which is a waste of time; 2) remove from_dict() method from Event which
is never used anywhere; 3) add an as_dict() method to the Event DB model
so that we still have a chance to convert datatime fields; 4) simplify
engine service layer so we can avoid doing deserialization of Events. 5)
remove all the deserialization methods from Event class.

Change-Id: I3b75632192014a60bb65b9556f9044a179d8d5c0

commit_message:
Capture module versions when built

This change adds a module_versions file that contains the versions of
the modules that were pulled down when update_modules.sh was run. We
need this to be able to reproduce the git modules since we are removing
the .git folders from the modules when they get packaged.

Change-Id: I6564bcb8c46343e1f11d4f0dac60a2c2646ada17
Closes-Bug: #1553385

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 14:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Add puppet-ovn to Puppet OpenStack

networking-ovn is a project part of OpenStack Neutron:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-ovn/readme.html

"OVN provides virtual networking for Open vSwitch and is a component of
the Open vSwitch project. This project provides integration between
OpenStack Neutron and OVN."

Red Hat started to work on a Puppet module that installs & configures OVN
services, on top of Open-vSwitch:
https://github.com/redhat-cip/puppet-ovn
We would like to move it to OpenStack under Puppet OpenStack tent.

Why not deploying OVN with puppet-vswitch?
OVN is a part of the OVS project. It's even in the same git repo as OVS
right now.
OVN consists of some new daemons and databases. It's optional components
that you may enable on top of OVS.
But openstack/puppet-vswitch abstracts away the vswitch details in its
interface, so puppet-ovn would likely consume puppet-vswitch.

Change-Id: Idd8dc346b8368c926a5f2fc5c2cc8c34376f30f5
'}]
commit_message:
Add puppet-ovn to Puppet OpenStack

networking-ovn is a project part of OpenStack Neutron:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/networking-ovn/readme.html

"OVN provides virtual networking for Open vSwitch and is a component of
the Open vSwitch project. This project provides integration between
OpenStack Neutron and OVN."

Red Hat started to work on a Puppet module that installs & configures OVN
services, on top of Open-vSwitch:
https://github.com/redhat-cip/puppet-ovn
We would like to move it to OpenStack under Puppet OpenStack tent.

Why not deploying OVN with puppet-vswitch?
OVN is a part of the OVS project. It's even in the same git repo as OVS
right now.
OVN consists of some new daemons and databases. It's optional components
that you may enable on top of OVS.
But openstack/puppet-vswitch abstracts away the vswitch details in its
interface, so puppet-ovn would likely consume puppet-vswitch.

Change-Id: Idd8dc346b8368c926a5f2fc5c2cc8c34376f30f5

commit_message:
add uuid-runtime to base image builds

Many devstack plugins use uuidgen to seed values. This is available in
all the images we've been running anywhere up until this point, except
the new dib images. While it can be installed in devstack, that
happens later than many plugins want it, and it's prevalence in all
local environments makes it something that people developing plugins
never even imagine would be an issue.

Add this into the base devstack image build to make dib reflect the
common expectation.

Change-Id: Ic5c91952acef826f19205db74623a39b152ecbb4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 13:36:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/api.py'], 'message': "Fix compatibility mode of backup jobs scheduling

While testing interoperability of Liberty and Mitaka services I've found
two problems with backup jobs scheduling when running in non-scalable
mode (this happens when we run mixed Liberty and Mitaka c-bak services,
so during the live upgrade).

First of all when passing volume.host into scheduling we don't strip it
from backend and pool parts (@backend#pool), so in multi-backend
environment scheduling doesn't match backup host names and that clue is
silently ignored.

Second problem is that we don't pass the target volume's host into the
scheduling when restoring the volume. This means that we don't schedule
the jobs exactly the old way and it may happen that Liberty's
cinder-backup will receive restore request with a target volume he don't
have access to.

This commit sorts both problems out. Please note that this is very
low-risk, as it affects only this non-scalable mode, which without this
is broken anyway.

Change-Id: Ib7195f27a1e455732db8621cd09ba87daa5d5a33
Closes-Bug: 1558073
"}]
commit_message:
Fix compatibility mode of backup jobs scheduling

While testing interoperability of Liberty and Mitaka services I've found
two problems with backup jobs scheduling when running in non-scalable
mode (this happens when we run mixed Liberty and Mitaka c-bak services,
so during the live upgrade).

First of all when passing volume.host into scheduling we don't strip it
from backend and pool parts (@backend#pool), so in multi-backend
environment scheduling doesn't match backup host names and that clue is
silently ignored.

Second problem is that we don't pass the target volume's host into the
scheduling when restoring the volume. This means that we don't schedule
the jobs exactly the old way and it may happen that Liberty's
cinder-backup will receive restore request with a target volume he don't
have access to.

This commit sorts both problems out. Please note that this is very
low-risk, as it affects only this non-scalable mode, which without this
is broken anyway.

Change-Id: Ib7195f27a1e455732db8621cd09ba87daa5d5a33
Closes-Bug: 1558073

compatibility in rpcapi and manager for 1.x, allowing for continuous
deployment scenarios.

This should be merged just before the Mitaka release.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continous deployment should not

commit_message:
Add backup RPC API v2.0

This patch creates backup RPC API version 2.0, while retaining
compatibility in rpcapi and manager for 1.x, allowing for continuous
deployment scenarios.

This should be merged just before the Mitaka release.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continous deployment should not
upgrade into Newton before doing an upgrade which includes all the
Mitaka's RPC API version bump commits (scheduler, volume, backup).

Related-Blueprint: rpc-object-compatibility

Change-Id: I0c66e4126901e6d60054d093cf87d43f4b9df666

commit_message:
Fix Security-rule's protocol and ethertype consistency issue

security rule ethertype can be set ipv6 when protocol is icmp.

This patch add check when protocol is icmp,ethertype value ipv6
should not accepted.

Change-Id: I27564bc649db0bafb630c0a8b7cb4f6a0679fff0
Closes-Bug: #1532061

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 23:22:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_common.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'message': "Outerjoin to networks for port ownership filter

Change I55328cb43207654b9bb4cfb732923982d020ab0a
added a port filter to compare tenant ID to the
network owner as well. This caused the networks
table to be added to the FROM statement since
ports wasn't joined to networks for any other
reason. This resulted in an explosion of records
returned (networks * ports). SQLAlchemy would
de-dup this for us when iterating over results;
however, it would completely break the 'count()'
operation required by get_ports_count (which
the quota engine uses).

Change-Id: I5b780121ba408fba691fff9304d4a22e5892b85f
Closes-Bug: #1558827
"}]
commit_message:
Outerjoin to networks for port ownership filter

Change I55328cb43207654b9bb4cfb732923982d020ab0a
added a port filter to compare tenant ID to the
network owner as well. This caused the networks
table to be added to the FROM statement since
ports wasn't joined to networks for any other
reason. This resulted in an explosion of records
returned (networks * ports). SQLAlchemy would
de-dup this for us when iterating over results;
however, it would completely break the 'count()'
operation required by get_ports_count (which
the quota engine uses).

Change-Id: I5b780121ba408fba691fff9304d4a22e5892b85f
Closes-Bug: #1558827

commit_message:
[CI] Check nova is available in deployment

At current moment attempt to create flavor
without checking nova availability leads
to failures on some gates, for example
gate-kuryr-dsvm-rally-nv. This patch eliminates
that issue.

Change-Id: Iee1e76d2fe8cc326686b67a27e0ab90469d54944
Closes-Bug: #1556775

commit_message:
dscp: follow up patch

test_base changes to hack around enum limitations.

subject: Set update_at to new value after resize
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 06:54:27.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_cluster.py', 'senlin/engine/cluster.py'], 'message': "Set update_at to new value after resize

No matter a cluster_resize is a deep one (that involves creation or
deletion of nodes) or a shallow one (that involves just size constraints
adjustments), we should always change the 'updated_at' property.

Change-Id: Iaacfdd93fb970ddc2bfb6d1de23b901e39376e20
"}]
commit_message:
Set update_at to new value after resize

No matter a cluster_resize is a deep one (that involves creation or
deletion of nodes) or a shallow one (that involves just size constraints
adjustments), we should always change the 'updated_at' property.

Change-Id: Iaacfdd93fb970ddc2bfb6d1de23b901e39376e20

subject: Improve TripleO testing coverage for Puppet OpenStack CI
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 13:04:59.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/tripleo.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Improve TripleO testing coverage for Puppet OpenStack CI

* Export puppet-barbican & puppet-oslo refs in TripleO jobs
* Run TripleO jobs when testing puppet-oslo and puppet-vswitch, two
  modules consummed or going to be (very soon) consummed by TripleO.

Change-Id: I11c1a1afef0ce76f50847b4a36f21a4b5039dc95
'}]
commit_message:
Improve TripleO testing coverage for Puppet OpenStack CI

* Export puppet-barbican & puppet-oslo refs in TripleO jobs
* Run TripleO jobs when testing puppet-oslo and puppet-vswitch, two
  modules consummed or going to be (very soon) consummed by TripleO.

Change-Id: I11c1a1afef0ce76f50847b4a36f21a4b5039dc95

subject: Enable gate jobs for Packstack on the stable/mitaka branch
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 19:23:40.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable gate jobs for Packstack on the stable/mitaka branch

The work to enable gate jobs for Packstack was done throughout the
Mitaka cycle and thus jobs were only enabled on Master. Now that
Mitaka stable branch is cut, run gate jobs on every branch except
stable/liberty and stable/kilo.

Change-Id: I9ab03d8a8c7c0ae0c02bc251893836a9da04aaf8
'}]
commit_message:
Enable gate jobs for Packstack on the stable/mitaka branch

The work to enable gate jobs for Packstack was done throughout the
Mitaka cycle and thus jobs were only enabled on Master. Now that
Mitaka stable branch is cut, run gate jobs on every branch except
stable/liberty and stable/kilo.

Change-Id: I9ab03d8a8c7c0ae0c02bc251893836a9da04aaf8

subject: oslo.db: don't run tests with SQLAlchemy 0.9.x
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 20:11:16.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "oslo.db: don't run tests with SQLAlchemy 0.9.x

We've been running tests with different SQLAlchemy release series
supported, but since Ic7ab3b9e6dc8354861be1af46210269f74c04333
oslo.db actually requires SQLAlchemy >= 1.0.10, so testing of 0.9.x
versions is not needed anymore.

Keep the job for stable/kilo and stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I591ec39572a725455aef52b3bc60d7a419daeb16
"}]
commit_message:
oslo.db: don't run tests with SQLAlchemy 0.9.x

We've been running tests with different SQLAlchemy release series
supported, but since Ic7ab3b9e6dc8354861be1af46210269f74c04333
oslo.db actually requires SQLAlchemy >= 1.0.10, so testing of 0.9.x
versions is not needed anymore.

Keep the job for stable/kilo and stable/liberty.

Change-Id: I591ec39572a725455aef52b3bc60d7a419daeb16

commit_message:
Fix event list sorting

At the client side, we should not attempt to do sorting again when
listing events. Events are already sorted based on timestamp and id.

Closes-Bug: #1558882
Change-Id: I2c42123bbde532080d752769a0d821f107e3aad1

commit_message:

testing on magnum and prove the image.

Currently there are some fields whose nullable in db
model and object don't match. This may lead object query

For example, for volume, if attach_status is nullable in
db schema, but is not nullable in object schema.
When writting data to db using db interface, the attach_status
can be null. But later when reading data from db to construct
volume object, it raises exception. As a result, all the
query related to the volume fails.

This patch is to make all the fields in corresponding db
model and object match.

commit_message:
Make nullable of fields in db model and object match

Currently there are some fields whose nullable in db
model and object don't match. This may lead object query
fails.

For example, for volume, if attach_status is nullable in
db schema, but is not nullable in object schema.
When writting data to db using db interface, the attach_status
can be null. But later when reading data from db to construct
volume object, it raises exception. As a result, all the
query related to the volume fails.

This patch is to make all the fields in corresponding db
model and object match.

Change-Id: I84fb16f0a67f9a1f7a09e91bb8ebe6298f3f49c4
Closes-Bug: #1549669
Related-Bug: #1549673

commit_message:
Add size checking when adding nodes

When adding nodes to a cluster, we should check the cluster size
constraints as early as possible instead of forking an action that will
fail later.

Change-Id: I2b6181f5752e4c5d369c072cf6452b5bd9a467c0

commit_message:
Use default service_type for Murano endpoints

Currently we have outdated Murano service_type in Murano keystone
modular. Service_type has been updated in Murano upstream source code [1]
and then was updated in upstream Murano puppet manifests [2]. But library
still has outdated value.

This patch switches using of service_type parameter to upstream puppet
default value, because we don't have any specific changes on Fuel side.

[1] Id568c0a59b2e99dc946b1f2f55f6b233fd6a1b27
[2] Ib0059f7f35744c22b0fbd2be5917d8818d392422

Change-Id: I762801c7c49e806f52c03f72275a527350c6be34
Closes-bug: #1558035

commit_message:
Change float to integer for cgroups memory value

Cgconfigparser can't parse float values and cgroups
settings doesn't apply on the nodes. So, function
should convert counted memory value to integer.

Change-Id: I65bb1df9a93d46e8313c6ba8c8f23ec6d37bb14d
Closes-bug: #1558103

commit_message:
Provide multipath-tools package for compute node

While we can configure ISCSI Multipath for nova compute, we will need to
install multipath-tools package manually to make Multipath work.
We can not attach volumes to instance when ISCSI Multipath enabled if
multipath-tools package isn`t installed.

Change-Id: Iad6819023aaa2b27bf78ca465eaf9aab5612f744
Closes-Bug: #1515291

commit_message:
Gate: Ensure that AIO container apt components match the host

This patch ensures that if the host is set to bootstrap with a different
set of components to the default, all containers will have the same set
of components.

Change-Id: I280ea0fc200450e5e4fc3147dbee353775e76df0
(cherry picked from commit b18c18e15d5feecd3db2dc7f5fa07174c1e49379)

subject: Secure mongodb instances and clusters by default
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 10295, 'name': 'mariam john', 'email': 'mariamj@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mariamj'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-17 15:12:03.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/cfg.py', 'trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/mongodb/api.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/mongodb/service.py'], 'message': "Secure mongodb instances and clusters by default

MongoDB's default behaviour is to have the authorization rules disabled.
This means any client can access the database without credentials. This
is too large of a risk for default behaviour, so authorization needs to
be enabled by default.

This fix addresses the problem by setting the authorization parameter to
enabled for standalone instances, and specifying key files for cluster
instances to use.

Change-Id: I5895ce66ec450c3efce7a7e0f126ac13ac4c1b12
Closes-bug: #1507841
"}]
commit_message:
Secure mongodb instances and clusters by default

MongoDB's default behaviour is to have the authorization rules disabled.
This means any client can access the database without credentials. This
is too large of a risk for default behaviour, so authorization needs to
be enabled by default.

This fix addresses the problem by setting the authorization parameter to
enabled for standalone instances, and specifying key files for cluster
instances to use.

Change-Id: I5895ce66ec450c3efce7a7e0f126ac13ac4c1b12
Closes-bug: #1507841

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 03:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix python-ironicclient pip install breakage

and _ separators, whereas other pypi mirrors do. This is stopping

Change-Id: I9b8bb450e199aadf3123b9a74cfe953e05d89952

commit_message:
Fix python-ironicclient pip install breakage

The pypi mirror that the openstack gate uses does not normalise -
and _ separators, whereas other pypi mirrors do. This is stopping
other reviews such as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293779/
from passing tests.

Change-Id: I9b8bb450e199aadf3123b9a74cfe953e05d89952
Signed-off-by: Michael Davies <michael@the-davies.net>

commit_message:
Add retry logic for detaching device using LibVirt

Add retry logic for removing a disk device from the LibVirt
guest domain XML. This is needed because immediately after a guest
reboot, libvirtmod.virDomainDetachDeviceFlags() will silently fail
to remove the mapping from the guest domain. The async retry
behavior is done in Guest and is generic so it can be re-used by any other
detaches which hit this same race condition.

Change-Id: I983f80822a5c210929f33e1aa348a0fef91e890b
Closes-Bug: #1374508
(cherry picked from commit 3a3fb3cfb2c41ad182545e47649ff12a4f3a743e)

revisions:

Docker has an undeclared dependency on apparmor for Ubuntu Trusty,
preventing the daemon from running and causing any -src jobs for IPA to

This should unbreak the IPA gate.

Change-Id: I98540286000d0cb1fe7649db5278c0a959ba8ad1
Closes-bug: 1558680
'}]
commit_message:
Install apparmor b/c Docker.io has undeclared dep

Docker has an undeclared dependency on apparmor for Ubuntu Trusty,
preventing the daemon from running and causing any -src jobs for IPA to
fail when using docker to build the package.

This should unbreak the IPA gate.

Change-Id: I98540286000d0cb1fe7649db5278c0a959ba8ad1
Closes-bug: 1558680

-get user

-revoke access

commit_message:
Fix pagination function

The marker should be the last element in the current page and not the
first element in the next page.
Also updated the scenario tests to account for different
marker format of MySQL-based instances and fixed the assertion arg order.

Change-Id: Iff5d9c4e55f9146ce7132c7968087b7e834e793e
Closes-Bug: 1540172

commit_message:
Check share-network in 'share create' API

For the moment it is possible to schedule share creation with DHSS=true
share type but without share network. But it makes no sense, and
expected to fail. So, perform check on API level.

APIImpact
When create share with share type(DHSS=true) and not input share
network, API will return HTTPBadRequest and message:
"Share network must be set when the driver_handles_share_servers
is true."

Closes-Bug: #1525125
Change-Id: Icdfabff7b1d3b6e95dd1dd58a0155de637056657

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-17 13:39:56.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/actions.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/tests/test_volumes.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/volumes/tables.py'], 'message': "Fix empty 'href' in link actions after AJAX actions_update

Since the non-existent template being used in
horizon.datatables.update_actions has been fixed (thanks to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281450/), we've started to experience
missing href for link actions in a table header (i.e. table actions)
after actions update.

This is fixed by explicitly passing 'is_table_action' flag while
rendering create/launch LinkAction-s that are known to be updated
after AJAX row update.

Guard against the bug regression with create_volume integration tests.

Change-Id: I46e27178d74815d945c752bf3b7302b7f0ddc27d
Closes-Bug: #1553314
"}]
commit_message:
Fix empty 'href' in link actions after AJAX actions_update

Since the non-existent template being used in
horizon.datatables.update_actions has been fixed (thanks to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281450/), we've started to experience
missing href for link actions in a table header (i.e. table actions)
after actions update.

This is fixed by explicitly passing 'is_table_action' flag while
rendering create/launch LinkAction-s that are known to be updated
after AJAX row update.

Guard against the bug regression with create_volume integration tests.

Change-Id: I46e27178d74815d945c752bf3b7302b7f0ddc27d
Closes-Bug: #1553314

commit_message:
Unskip test_list_virtual_interfaces

Nova will return a 400 in the case of using Neutron as the
network API. Remove the skip such that a 400 is expected in
the case of using Neutron, else it's a failure.

Nova will implement the API for neutron in a microversion.

Depends-On: I27f48b38d64b34277f001fba86b4e64e9ead937c

Change-Id: I409fc6349a40396be68796fc82e5c1f37242bbdb
Related-Bug: #1183436

If using the Neutron network API, listing VIFs will return
a 500. This changes that to return a 400, which does not
require a microversion according to our docs:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html

A later change will introduce a microversion to implement the
method for the Neutron API.

Conflicts:
        nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/virtual_interfaces.py
        nova/api/openstack/compute/virtual_interfaces.py
        nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_virtual_interfaces.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the module paths moving in
Liberty and the fake HTTPRequest didn't have the wsgi_api_version kwarg
in Kilo.

Change-Id: I27f48b38d64b34277f001fba86b4e64e9ead937c
Related-Bug: #1183436
(cherry picked from commit cae96dccaff6d11e8dbd0e043676eb86e6fe73d8)
(cherry picked from commit c5da5d05763133b52cc9f3bf60884195c9dcab16)
"}]
commit_message:
Return 400 for os-virtual-interfaces when using Neutron

If using the Neutron network API, listing VIFs will return
a 500. This changes that to return a 400, which does not
require a microversion according to our docs:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api_microversion_dev.html

A later change will introduce a microversion to implement the
method for the Neutron API.

Conflicts:
        nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/virtual_interfaces.py
        nova/api/openstack/compute/virtual_interfaces.py

commit_message:
Adding a note to 'test_update_user_password' test for Keystone V2

A note with time.sleep(1) were added for consistency like it is done
for the corresponding tests in [1]. Also, a few typos were fixed and
weird self.assertEqual(...)

    subject_token = resp['x-subject-token']
    ...
    self.assertEqual(resp['x-subject-token'], subject_token)

was deleted.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275497/

Change-Id: I9cdd49a5361e21205a470da21d5cf69ce5b464bf

commit_message:
Tolerate both new and old setuptools

New setuptools 20.2.2 seems to be throwing a new exception
as it uses a vendorized version of packaging now. Let's make
sure our tests works with both the older and newer versions.

This is a backport of Iab9247e2026896bb7d25b125788ec3072f819dad.

(cherry picked from commit 0cf3c06ad98fa86378ffd561b65c0154989b179c)

Comment other-requirements.txt

Add a comment why the database packages are currently needed in the
file.

This is a backport of Idbbdf7aa905e42eb36733271ef482989120c426f.

(cherry picked from commit e19caa9c0e8342e983132dab9e470ec69c973820)

Fix other-requirements.txt

With the switch to bindep based packages the other-requirements.txt file
is used. It contains an error: The libxslt devel is called
libxslt1-dev on Ubuntu Trusty.

Also, add mysql-server and mysql-client packages, as well as postgresql
packages, those are needed by gate-requirements-python27.

Add pypy packages for pypy gate.

This is a backport of Ie143ad862b88034ef47470b85fd02c1d040415a7.

Change-Id: Ie143ad862b88034ef47470b85fd02c1d040415a7
(cherry picked from commit a9b887b4020431e177fd5f62092ef636a4ec398d)

commit_message:
Tolerate both new and old setuptools

New setuptools 20.2.2 seems to be throwing a new exception
as it uses a vendorized version of packaging now. Let's make
sure our tests works with both the older and newer versions.

Conflicts:
        openstack_requirements/tests/test_requirement.py

NOTE(mriedem): There were a bunch of tests that weren't in kilo.

Change-Id: Iab9247e2026896bb7d25b125788ec3072f819dad
(cherry picked from commit 0cf3c06ad98fa86378ffd561b65c0154989b179c)

commit_message:
Add better validation to cluster shrink

Most cluster strategies need to block certain cluster shrink operations
under some conditions. For example Vertica can easily determine if a
master node has been targetted and should gracefully block this and
notify the operator.

Change-Id: I2fea16cd7eeec81510563daffcea1d2dbdf1eab5
Closes-bug: #1557784

subject: Adjust tooltip position for homepage gauges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 17:56:58.000000000', 'files': ['app/views/home.html'], 'message': 'Adjust tooltip position for homepage gauges

This commit changes the tooltip placement for the horizontal gauge
charts on the homepage. Previously they would be rendered to the right
of the charts, but this could easily get cut off and cause a
horizontal scrollbar to appear. Tooltips are now placed above the
charts, and animations have also been disabled to avoid any lag
caused while scrolling or moving over many charts.

Change-Id: I6061fb634002ffefc1dea785621bd098bed32331
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust tooltip position for homepage gauges

This commit changes the tooltip placement for the horizontal gauge
charts on the homepage. Previously they would be rendered to the right
of the charts, but this could easily get cut off and cause a
horizontal scrollbar to appear. Tooltips are now placed above the
charts, and animations have also been disabled to avoid any lag
caused while scrolling or moving over many charts.

Change-Id: I6061fb634002ffefc1dea785621bd098bed32331

commit_message:
Update comments for keystone precision and fernet

Keystone is moving to drop microsecond precision across the board
for consistency. This updates the comments to reflect that the sleep
is not a bug and expected.

Change-Id: I8beaeb4a94f0de1ad5d89df9ec77a1ae1b08a9d1
Closes-Bug: #1517697
Closes-Bug: #1513538

subject: Better identify deprecated configuration options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-16 22:10:29.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py'], 'message': 'Better identify deprecated configuration options

If a configuration option is tagged as deprecated in the code and the
help text does not start with DEPRECATED: add this to better identify
options that are no longer used.

If the code provides an additional deprecated reason, append this to
the provided help text of the configuration option.

Change-Id: I1a7c76c0109a6e59cc87d0ddc942c6d1cfb9dc91
'}]
commit_message:
Better identify deprecated configuration options

If a configuration option is tagged as deprecated in the code and the
help text does not start with DEPRECATED: add this to better identify
options that are no longer used.

If the code provides an additional deprecated reason, append this to
the provided help text of the configuration option.

Change-Id: I1a7c76c0109a6e59cc87d0ddc942c6d1cfb9dc91

subject: Provide a more human identifable option data type
revisions:

Update the configuration tables option type from an internal meta type
to a more meaningful description.  E.g. Boolean for BoolOpt, String
for StringOpt, Multi-valued for MultiStrOpt etc.

commit_message:
Provide a more human identifable option data type

Update the configuration tables option type from an internal meta type
to a more meaningful description.  E.g. Boolean for BoolOpt, String
for StringOpt, Multi-valued for MultiStrOpt etc.

Inspired by the translation used in Developer Docs

Change-Id: I5bd7aec727292ceef4dc0ff56ab8f334ea2f22bc

subject: Catch sqlalchemy.exc.InvalidRequestError exception
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-16 21:34:11.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp.py'], 'message': "Catch sqlalchemy.exc.InvalidRequestError exception

Running update of keystone produces the following exception which
teminates processing. This enables processing to continue, like
capture of other types of errors.
* Table 'federation_protocol' is already defined for this MetaData
  instance.  Specify 'extend_existing=True' to redefine options and
  columns on an existing Table object.

Cater for projects that do not use sqlalchemy, e.g. swift.

Change-Id: I87df4bb784f94b7194374b2448e4c34beadb923f
"}]
commit_message:
Catch sqlalchemy.exc.InvalidRequestError exception

Running update of keystone produces the following exception which
teminates processing. This enables processing to continue, like
capture of other types of errors.
* Table 'federation_protocol' is already defined for this MetaData
  instance.  Specify 'extend_existing=True' to redefine options and
  columns on an existing Table object.

Cater for projects that do not use sqlalchemy, e.g. swift.

Change-Id: I87df4bb784f94b7194374b2448e4c34beadb923f

commit_message:
Add hacking check rule for not using xrange()

xrange() does not exist in python3.
Add hacking check rule so that codes with xragne() never pass test.

Change-Id: I643cf5edf837011c29e5c05805f0ee86bfbbd0f8

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-17 20:14:05.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Wait for docker to be up before building IPA

Initscript fires before the socket exists[0], and we end up
racing between docker creating the socket and beginning the
IPA build. Wait for the socket before building.

[0] https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/6647

Co-Authored-By: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1558680
Change-Id: Iec97236018025e0bfb18c5f156293179e40e9c86
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for docker to be up before building IPA

Initscript fires before the socket exists[0], and we end up
racing between docker creating the socket and beginning the
IPA build. Wait for the socket before building.

[0] https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/6647

Co-Authored-By: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1558680

commit_message:
User Guide Identity and Shared File Systems chapters - Reorganization and Edit

1.) This patch edits several files in the Identity and Shared File Systems chapters of the
    Cloud Admin Guide for word choice and clarity as a part of the User Guide Reorg.

2.) This patch also reorganizes two small identity service files that
    provide information on specic features into a
    single file headed by a keystone service useage example.

The new file can contain small feature additions in future
releases, keeping them in a single file to prevent the Admin Guide content becoming disorganised.

Change-Id: I0699e500cdd98183de1d8964ab92cc6e3b693e02
Implements: blueprint user-guides-reorganised

commit_message:
Add Network IP Availability API Extention

There was api merged for Network IP Availaibility [1]. This change
basically implements new extension that can be used to check network
usage stats of all the networks or specific network created by neutron.
There is also patch [2] upstream and close to merge for client commands

This patch will add how to configure it and commands used to get that
information.

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212955/
[2]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/269926/

Closes-Bug: #1551907
Change-Id: I5a6df488147240c11a4bad7f03320469bc8a3be6

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-14 14:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_conf.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_huawei_drivers.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/rest_client.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/replication.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/Huawei-volume-driver-replication-v2.1-ada5bc3ad62dc633.yaml'], 'message': "Huawei: Implement v2.1 replication

This patch implements the v2.1 replication in the HuaweiDriver.
All function in replication v2 are removed. A new function,
failover_host, is added to support failover between backends.

When error occurred on primary backend, you can failover to
the secondary backend. But it's strongly recommended to recover
the primary backend.

After failover backend, the operations on the secondary backend
are limited. A simple example, if you create a new volume on
secondary, after failback, it can't be used. So, You should not
do that, such as create, delete, extend volumes, etc.

But you can detach volume if it's in in-use status, then do
attach to vm to make replication volumes R&W.

The configuration for v2.1 is almost the same as v2. Except that,
only one backend configuration is needed. A simple example as
follows:

[replica]
volume_driver =
    cinder.volume.drivers.huawei.huawei_driver.HuaweiISCSIDriver
    cinder_huawei_conf_file = /etc/cinder/cinder_huawei_conf.xml
    replication_device = backend_id:huawei-replica-1,
        storage_pool:pool_1,
        san_address:san_url_1;san_url_2,
        iscsi_default_target_ip:192.168.1.100,
        san_user:admin,san_password:passwd

Change-Id: Ib555707e9751f78ce00c9dcdbbe370a18ed0ae6c
Closes-Bug: #1556450
"}]
commit_message:
Huawei: Implement v2.1 replication

This patch implements the v2.1 replication in the HuaweiDriver.
All function in replication v2 are removed. A new function,
failover_host, is added to support failover between backends.

When error occurred on primary backend, you can failover to
the secondary backend. But it's strongly recommended to recover
the primary backend.

After failover backend, the operations on the secondary backend
are limited. A simple example, if you create a new volume on
secondary, after failback, it can't be used. So, You should not
do that, such as create, delete, extend volumes, etc.

But you can detach volume if it's in in-use status, then do
attach to vm to make replication volumes R&W.

The configuration for v2.1 is almost the same as v2. Except that,
only one backend configuration is needed. A simple example as
follows:

[replica]
volume_driver =
    cinder.volume.drivers.huawei.huawei_driver.HuaweiISCSIDriver
    cinder_huawei_conf_file = /etc/cinder/cinder_huawei_conf.xml
    replication_device = backend_id:huawei-replica-1,
        storage_pool:pool_1,
        san_address:san_url_1;san_url_2,
        iscsi_default_target_ip:192.168.1.100,
        san_user:admin,san_password:passwd

Change-Id: Ib555707e9751f78ce00c9dcdbbe370a18ed0ae6c
Closes-Bug: #1556450

it's the default value.

restart_docker_container is now implemented in C language, but it is not
neccesory and makes it difficult to manage it.
This patch re-implements that script by python because python is more

Change-Id: I808e5d2e1c194c5df437c7bd1ef1c7b055d6d2dd

commit_message:
Re-implement restart_docker_container by python

restart_docker_container is now implemented in C language, but it is not
neccesory and makes it difficult to manage it.
This patch re-implements that script by python because python is more
appreciated in OpenStack project.

Change-Id: I808e5d2e1c194c5df437c7bd1ef1c7b055d6d2dd

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method in favor of warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning,
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: Ia2566aaf510ecc14d62d965f0e3b7e79b8b99628
Closes-Bug: #1508442

commit_message:
[CLI] bay-list should show the name of baymodel

Add baymodel_name to bay_list. Now users have a fast way to know
 their bays based on which baymodel, and can know bay configurations
 quickly without showing the bay.

Change-Id: I7cbec46a7f03b75fa520261ffc24348e7fac9f18
Closes-Bug: #1535687

commit_message:
Allow per node configuration with augments

This type of per node configuration is required to support things like
availability zones for nova. As always, if this file doesnt exist it
doesnt get used so this change is safe.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iff8172af522c2c96e5f2c173b24a5dfd4d522ed2

[install-guides] make pipeline configuration actual one line

"pipeline" must be only one line in ceilometer-swift.rst, which it
easy to misguide deployer to four lines before this patch set.

commit_message:
fullstack: use SIGTERM when stopping ovs agents

ovs agents should be killed with SIGTERM, otherwise orphaned
ovsdb-clients remain.
Related-bug: 1487548

Change-Id: Ibf840f2a50ff4078b6828cdc25e0ac61f98e1fd3

subject: Fix incorrect innobackupex args (fixed gate)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-17 21:22:31.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/mysql_impl.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_backups.py'], 'message': 'Fix incorrect innobackupex args (fixed gate)

A recent release of Percona XtraBackup has tightened up the
validation of options passed to the innobackupex script.

See:
https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtrabackup/2.3/release-notes/2.3/2.3.4.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/percona-xtrabackup/+bug/1533542

The options supplied to innobackupex in the MySQL restore strategy
are slightly incorrect - this was ignored previously but now causes
the backups to fail.

The options are now specified correctly.

Change-Id: Ic4671998f0c4467f17caa60cbb3106f49c505a2e
Closes-Bug: #1558794
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect innobackupex args (fixed gate)

A recent release of Percona XtraBackup has tightened up the
validation of options passed to the innobackupex script.

See:
https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtrabackup/2.3/release-notes/2.3/2.3.4.html
https://bugs.launchpad.net/percona-xtrabackup/+bug/1533542

The options supplied to innobackupex in the MySQL restore strategy
are slightly incorrect - this was ignored previously but now causes
the backups to fail.

The options are now specified correctly.

Change-Id: Ic4671998f0c4467f17caa60cbb3106f49c505a2e
Closes-Bug: #1558794

above command "ceph-mon --mkfs --id --keyring ..." will generate

Change-Id: Iac3c69f4abe0469ccaef6991164698e25fcf3d09
